document.title: WIDA English Language Development Standards Framework 2020

8F01620B95024F6BB97FD69B77C2CFC6.description:
Show relationships between claims and
counterclaims, differences in perspectives,
and evidence and reasoning

8B2B44328F7E4F9C83246F9FE38F8772.description:
Select relevant information to support
claims with evidence gathered from
multiple sources

897D7FE71A614085A885791BF9B252EC.description:
Evaluating point of view and credibility of
source based on relevance and intended
use

01FDEAEE65D84A0C89947F4AA2E86CB7.description:
Analyzing relevant information from
multiple sources to support claims

50A6EFDEDFF34A009FF5F7DA3EC1552D.description:
Identifying topic and purpose (argue
in favor or against a position, present
a balanced interpretation, challenge
perspective)

335EB14C0AB54D138AE8C8CB5ECDDA61.description:
Generalize multiple causes and effects of
developments or events

74C42D6D24C948FDA290D5A8F60D47C9.description:
Develop reasoning, sequences with linear
and nonlinear relationships, evidence,
and details, acknowledging strengths and
weaknesses

2DFC4CF850C3493E86269FEAF87E23A0.description:
Establish perspective for communicating
outcomes, consequences, or
documentation

759B5E1E232C402DAAD85A4D8383502D.description:
Introduce and contextualize phenomena or
events

952CCB282ED949AF97D3111899C1F99B.description:
Evaluate experts’ points of agreement,
along with strengths and weakness of
explanations

D6F2CB8FE5A94AF9926EB0FD8C9FE630.description:
Analyzing sources for logical relationships
among contributing factors or causes

651FBBE7F4A542FFBF7A70AB91AD7DDF.description:
Determining multiple points of view in
sources for answering compelling and
supporting questions about phenomena or
events

98B48DBFEA284C76957508AD475ED04B.description:
Signal logical relationships among
reasoning, evidence, data, and/or a model
when making or defending a claim or
counterclaim

1DB62C91C9164550A5F9AD1FA92EAB8B.description:
Establish and maintain a neutral or
objective stance

1915B2ADCD8E4A4693EAA8FCAD17D18D.description:
Support or refute a claim based on data
and evidence

0FD2FF3F1200412192A9B31489E648F0.description:
Introduce and contextualize topic/
phenomenon in issues related to the natural
and designed world(s)

7D050F99A6724A0396899BC86D4F7A23.description:
Evaluating whether they emphasize similar
or different evidence and/or interpretations
of facts

BEEDD80464D0434B91929CF63C694FAA.description:
Comparing reasoning and claims based on
evidence from two arguments on the same
topic

27A052CFBD1A4954BB21833B7F5B7D51.description:
Identifying convincing evidence from
data, models, and/or information from
investigations of phenomena or design
solutions

F539583EBF634CED9C598985002648D5.description:
Summarize patterns in evidence, making
trade-offs, revising, and retesting

D8F53C66A17B42028735D38F98B570A0.description:
Develop reasoning to show relationships
among independent and dependent
variables in models and simple systems

E1FDD90ADCE44D77B3DD21EBD48C4827.description:
Establish neutral or objective stance in how
results are communicated

F5427A903DA541E3BA1244C3664120A4.description:
Describe valid and reliable evidence from
sources about a phenomenon

614E37B886744DDBBF186FC821BBE2B6.description:
Evaluating scientific reasoning that shows
why data or evidence adequately supports
conclusions

4A8D4C6FA9CA483E936009BBDD08C0DF.description:
Determining central ideas in complex
evidence and information to help explain
how or why a phenomenon occurs

91BFDE225A9549AE89B0B4AF7F2B428C.description:
Defining investigable questions or
design problems based on observations,
information, and/or data about a
phenomenon

38FD5AC13BA144F784859263A29E5698.description:
Justify conclusions with evidence and
mathematical facts

082A615B75D24C22A03D1FA076E58DE3.description:
Create conjecture, using definitions and
previously established results

D818EFC8F59D4375B906246A65192A6B.description:
Evaluating relationships between
evidence and mathematical facts to create
generalizations

EADB189A32C84F13A2B401F508A8C9AA.description:
Comparing conjectures with previously
established results

8AAC8ACCB313493092E660EF91D0274D.description: State reasoning used to generate solution

75645BEF20354C3FAB26CE903A26DE79.description:
Evaluating model and rationale for
underlying relationships in selected
problem-solving approach

58232FE789DB4FAF9E830ADE8FDA6C75.description:
Analyzing possible ways to represent and
solve a problem

50C460D573A044B9AFC84A75BAA942CB.description:
Logically organize claim(s) with clear reasons
and relevant evidence; offer a conclusion

620858CE645342EA8795E8247CCF130E.description:
Support claims with reasons and evidence that
are clear, relevant, and credible

E553C92214DB457CA4730A10F302CF18.description:
Introduce and develop claim(s) and
acknowledge counterclaim(s)

368B7A20C4CC4823A23EC4EEB44B8F25.description:
Evaluating relevance, sufficiency of
evidence, and validity of reasoning that
support claim(s)

DF6B0A73BC824DA99C591DE4D13834AB.description:
Analyzing how an author
acknowledges and responds to
conflicting evidence or viewpoints

0AA089B24F10470C994E2377456305D9.description:
Identifying and summarizing central
idea distinct from prior knowledge or
opinions

DB0ED370936446D3BA0CD51E43DE8475.description:
Develop coherence and cohesion throughout
text

9DD3F2455DC04A2CAF09B22478F945D5.description:
Add precision, details, and clarity about
relevant attributes, qualities, characteristics,
activities, and behaviors

FF4B5F253CCA4465B9A1D51167841AC6.description:
Introduce and define topic and/or entity for
audience

6D1DE7597C544EC2A5840C106E74389B.description: Construct informational texts in language arts that

133D329404074767A854FEEAE92D32A7.description:
Evaluating the impact of author’s key
word choices over the course of a text

E62183A050074D33A2F5332E6639123A.description:
Analyzing observations and
descriptions in textual evidence for
key attributes, qualities, characteristics,
activities, and behaviors

EAAD91EA92134192A698C8943CD47FA6.description:
Identifying and/or summarizing
main ideas and their relationship to
supporting ideas

C195BC5AAAE843149C969D534D4F0BEE.description:
Interpret informational texts in language
arts by

5A90272615734431AC448CCB99EAE5B7.description: Develop story, including themes with complication and resolution, time, and event sequences

0CD4BCE2E8CF4900BB1A94345957EFC2.description: Develop and describe characters and their relationships

657FA179A0004755BCA79B417F0A2B5D.description: Orient audience to context and point of view

2A949D9B8C6A4B79A38D149FB3544E78.description: Evaluating impact of specific word choices about meaning and tone

7EB29DB66DFC4A28B5463F57DA504FFE.description: Analyzing how character attributes and actions develop in relation to events or dialogue

C6F68DF574E5413C9F015EF5EA10ED1D.description: Identifying a theme or central idea that develops over the course of a text

E621E62B7B58408FB5CE2E052F10D2B0.description: Refine claims and reasoning based on new information or evidence

468AE89C616D4E14B8A0E932874B2158.description: Evaluate changes in thinking, identifying trade-offs

4FDC958B96F04B63A027194361BBE516.description: Clarify and elaborate ideas based on feedback

18666A0B8003443697C3B278E701145B.description: Support or challenge an opinion, premise, or interpretation

08402C1691D142B9A057DFC976D9CE9F.description: Act on feedback to revise understandings of how or why something is or works in particular ways

AB425922CA5C4C4A991A3AF65F2E6630.description: Offer alternatives to extend or deepen awareness of factors that contribute to particular outcomes

AE198304245940A0B144CE87A5EEEFA8.description: Compare changing variables, factors, and circumstances

CC4B3489FEFD4533BE050CAF52943C6C.description: Follow and describe cycles and sequences of steps or procedures and their causes and effects

CA61F80DFB814A268225660F380EA47C.description: Summarize most important aspects of information

745DA56F9B8B4E0B97648075D5D5C163.description: Describe the parts and wholes of a system

18BA430F026A406A82197B742624F519.description: Report on explicit and inferred characteristics, patterns, or behavior

A96B67CE953E4C509F602FADA13C1B8E.description: Define and classify facts and interpretations; determine what is known vs. unknown

6F212EE8360F4FF1BD11C0ADD45EB30F.description: Create closure, recap, and offer next steps

7F263B0FC30C43A6A49012446C868DD3.description: Recount and restate ideas to sustain and move dialogue forward

A64719C9882C4629AE07F59758FA91FB.description: Identify and raise questions about what might be unexplained, missing, or left unsaid

FA890DCD0A154DD4A9D65C9E595C28FB.description: Connect stories with images and representations to add meaning

9BC6F5BC6F2C421B94CEE7352EB441C6.description: Share ideas about one’s own and others’ lived experiences and previous learning
